bill_title: provide a procedure for the collection of delinquent taxes on leased sites and to revise the notice and publication of delinquent taxes.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a procedure for the collection of delinquent taxes on leased sites and to revise the notice and publication of delinquent taxes. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-9-13.1 be amended to read as follows: 10-9-13.1. It shall be the duty of the The county treasurer to shall collect the tax imposed by this chapter upon mobile homes by this chapter and buildings located on leased sites within sixty days after the same shall become delinquent provided that a distress warrant shall not be issued unless the notification of such delinquency and publication as provided by § § 10-22-1 to 10-22-3, inclusive, shall be and 10-22-2 that the taxes are delinquent is given to the owner and conditional vendor . However, no distress warrant may be issued unless the owner and conditional vendor received notice of the delinquency at least forty-five days prior to the issuance of such the distress warrant. Section 2. That § 10-22-1 be amended to read as follows: 10-22-1. Between the first and the fifth days of June fifteenth day of November in each year, the county treasurer shall prepare and mail a statement to all persons each person owing mobile home taxes or taxes on a building located on a leased site which are delinquent, except those entered on the uncollectible mobile home tax list or owing by persons known to the treasurer to be dead. Such The statement shall be dated the first day of June and shall show the amount of such the delinquent mobile home taxes or delinquent taxes on a building located on a leased site computed to the date of such the statement and shall contain thereon a statement notifying notify the person owing such the delinquent taxes that unless the same delinquent taxes are paid in full on or before the thirtieth day of June following November , a penalty of one dollar will shall be added each year to the delinquent taxes and that a notice of such the delinquent taxes will shall be published in the official newspapers of the county during the week next preceding the fifteenth day of July third Monday in December . Section 3. That § 10-22-2 be amended to read as follows: 10-22-2. During the week next preceding the fifteenth day of July third Monday in December in each year, the county treasurer shall publish in each of the official newspapers of the county, the names of all persons name of each person whose mobile home taxes or taxes on a building located on a leased site are delinquent. Such The notice shall contain the name of each taxpayer owing delinquent mobile home taxes or delinquent taxes on a building located on a leased site and the aggregate amount thereof in one lump sum , including interest and penalty, remaining unpaid , but such list need not . The notice does not need to include the name of any such delinquent taxpayer known to the county treasurer to be dead. The county treasurer shall charge and collect in addition to the taxes, penalty and interest, the sum of one dollar against each person whose name appears in such the publication , which sum, when collected, shall be paid . The county treasurer shall deposit the money collected into the county treasury and the . The county shall pay to the publisher of each official newspaper the notice the sum of thirty-three cents for each name appearing in such publications the notice . Section 4. That § 10-22-3 be repealed. 10-22-3. Between the first and fifth days of December in each year, the county treasurer shall prepare and mail a statement to all persons whose mobile home taxes became delinquent on the next preceding first day of November. Such statement shall be dated December first and shall show the amount of such delinquent mobile home taxes with interest and penalty computed to the date of such statement and shall contain therein a statement notifying the person owing such delinquent taxes that unless the same are paid in full on or before the thirty-first day of December, following, a penalty of one dollar will be added thereto.
